title: Sr. IE Analyst
job_desc:
BRIEF DESCRIPTION

The Senior IE Analyst is responsible for mapping, analyzing, and optimizing processes across multiple departments to enhance efficiency and reduce operational risks. This role involves leading process improvement initiatives, managing projects, facilitating communication, and leveraging technical proficiency to implement innovative solutions.  


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Map and document existing processes across various departments.

  • Create detailed flowcharts and process documentation to ensure clarity and consistency.

  • Analyze processes for inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and risks.

  • Use data-driven approaches to identify root causes of operational issues.

  • Identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend effective solutions.

  • Develop and propose strategies to optimize processes and enhance performance.

  • Benchmark processes against industry best practices to ensure competitive advantage.

  • Lead the implementation of approved process improvement initiatives.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth and effective implementation.

  • Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and budgets for process improvement projects.

  • Ensure projects are completed within scope, on time, and within budget.

  • Coordinate with stakeholders and team members to ensure alignment and project success.

  • Facilitate communication and collaboration among team members and stakeholders.

  • Track project progress, manage risks, and address any issues that arise.

  • Evaluate project outcomes and success against predefined metrics.

  • Prepare and present comprehensive reports on project results and recommendations to management.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor's Degree in Industrial Engineering, Business Management, Operations Management, Engineering Management, or a related field Master's Degree in Business Administration or Engineering Management (preferred but not required)

  • 5 to 7 years of experience doing Operations Engineering, Process Improvement, and Analysis

  • Experience in working for a logistics company is an advantage

  • Must be proficient in data analysis and use of Excel

  • Willing to do field work in cold storage warehouses

title: Business Process Improvement Analyst - Finance
company: Michael Page International Recruitment Philippines Inc.
job_desc:
Job Description 

We are seeking a detail-oriented and innovative Business Analyst to join our team in the manufacturing industry. This role will report directly to the Process Architecture and Transformation Manager and will be responsible for improving processes that leverage both SAP and non-SAP applications through advanced technology and innovative process designs. The primary focus will be on Robotic Process Automation (RPA), automation, and simplification, with success measured through operational KPIs. 

Key Responsibilities:

Process Analysis and Improvement: 
• Analyze and document current business processes within Commercial and Supply Chain domains. 
• Identify areas for improvement and develop innovative solutions to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. 
• Implement process improvements leveraging SAP and non-SAP applications. 

Technology and Innovation: 
• Utilize advanced technologies such as RPA and automation to streamline business processes. 
• Design and implement simplified processes that reduce complexity and improve operational performance. 
• Stay updated with the latest technological advancements and industry best practices. 

KPI Development and Monitoring: 
• Develop and define operational KPIs to measure the efficiency and value of processes. 
• Monitor and analyze KPI performance, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement. 
• Ensure process changes are aligned with business objectives and KPIs. 

Collaboration and Communication: 
• Work closely with the Process Architecture and Transformation Manager and other team members. 
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including technical engineers and business stakeholders, to ensure successful implementation of process improvements. 
• Facilitate workshops and meetings to gather requirements and feedback. 

Documentation and Reporting: 
• Prepare detailed documentation of process improvements, including process maps, workflows, and technical specifications. 
• Generate regular reports on project status, process performance, and KPI outcomes. 
• Provide clear and concise communication to all relevant stakeholders. 
 

Qualifications 

Education: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Industrial Engineering, or a related field. 

Experience: 

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role within the manufacturing industry. 
  • Proven experience with SAP and non-SAP applications. 
  • Strong background in process improvement, RPA, automation, and simplification initiatives. 

Skills: 

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. 
  • Proficiency in process mapping and analysis tools. 
  • Knowledge of RPA tools and automation technologies. 
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills. 
  • Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. 
  • Experience with KPI development and performance monitoring. 

Competencies: 

  • Innovation and Creativity 
  • Analytical Thinking 
  • Collaboration and Teamwork 
  • Results Orientation 
  • Adaptability and Flexibility 

What we offer

  • Competitive salary with up to 14th-month pay
  • Comprehensive medical and wellness benefits.
  • HMO with 2-3 dependents
  • Life & Accident Insurance
  • Retirement benefit
  • Leaves which are convertible to cash

title: URGENT: Business Analyst (CRM + Insurance Background is a must)
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila
job_desc:
Key Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their needs and gather detailed business requirements.
• Analyze and document business processes, workflows, and systems related to Life Asia.
• Identify areas for process improvement and recommend solutions to enhance operational efficiency.
• Develop and implement business strategies to achieve organizational goals.
• Conduct data analysis and provide actionable insights to support decision-making.
• Facilitate workshops and meetings to elicit requirements and ensure stakeholder alignment.
• Prepare detailed reports, presentations, and documentation to communicate findings and recommendations.
• Work closely with IT teams to ensure the successful implementation of business solutions.
• Monitor and evaluate the performance of implemented solutions to ensure they meet business objectives.

Qualifications:

  • Contact center / CRM experience mandatory

  • Insurance experience mandatory

  • User facing projects

  • Need to have experience in managing CRM development projects. [Not some project with CRM as source.]

  • Good working experience in developing CRM applications

  • Needs to be very good at documenting processes.

  • BA has to write a full BRD for CRM 360 view + processes along with Backend mapping / flows etc.

title: BUSINESS PROCESS ANALYST (Head Office)
job_desc:
Requirements:

 

  • Graduate of Bachelors Degree in Industrial Engineering
  • With knowledge in any of the following applications: Microsoft Office; Oracle; AS/400 or any program language
  • Willing to work onsite- SM Retail Headquarters, Pasay

 

Responsibilities:

  • Develops process improvement procedures to improve operational efficiency

Skills

  • strong analytical background

  • MS Office proficient

title: Process Improvement Analyst
job_desc:
Hired candidates will have the following opportunities:

  • Competitive salary based on relevant skills and work experience
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Career development opportunities for high potential and top performing employees

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Graduate of BS Industrial Engineering, Accountancy, Management Information System, Internal Auditing or other related courses
  • With at least one year of related work experience

 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Prepares audit plans to ensure that the time allotted to the audit is properly managed such that it is maximized without effect to the depth / quality of audit output.
  • Coordinates with the Department Head / Representative of the department the contents of the audit plan.
  • Performs planned audits and surveillances of executed business process to ensure compliance.
  • Issues audit finding based on the available documents.
  • Prepares audit reports based on the audit findings.
  • Assists the auditee in using the Quality Assurance System and responds to the immediate concerns.

title: Business Development Engineer
company: Multivac Pte Ltd - Rep office in the Philippines
job_desc:
1.

Primary Responsibilities

 

Sales Engineer

1. Identify potential sales opportunities in the food processing and bakery  industry with existing customers and new prospects by making personal sales calls, following up on leads provided by the company, and by other prospecting methods as appropriate.

2. Utilize resources provided by the company to further the sales process including marketing tools, demonstration facilities, and other sales associates as necessary.

3. Work closely with Sales Administration in the quote and order process, according to established procedures.

4. Utilize CRM(C4C) according to established procedures, such as, professionally and efficiently update and maintain all CRM data including customer data, all customer contact details, current opportunity forecast data, along with competitive information.

5. Provide all necessary information and documentation for the completion of sales proposals and orders. Take responsibility for managing customer expectations as they relate to the order process.

6. Monitor and report competitive activity in territory and elsewhere.

7. Attend and participate in trade shows, sales meetings, industry meetings and other activities as directed by management.

8. Be an active student of the industry and of good selling practices.

 

2.

Requirement

1. Bachelor of Science in electrical engineering or equivalent

2. Sales experience in food processing and/or food packaging industry

3. Applicants with a strong background in the food/bakery industry preferred

4. Experienced in MS Office Applications ( Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams )

5. DL, owns a car

 

 

3.

Personal Attributes / Characteristics

  1. High integrity and positive attitude
  2. Possess excellent customer service focus, interpersonal and communication skills
  3. Ability to work independently, proactive, assertive and creative
  4. Must be bilingual in English/Tagalog
  5. Willing to travel occasionally within the PH and to Germany/Asian countries
  6. Possess initiative and meticulous in work
  7. Good organizing and planning skills

 

 

4.

Remuneration

  1. Basic Salary = 50 K – 65 K PHP
  2. Commission on sales
  3. Transport Reimbursement
  4. Car allowance
  5. Year End Bonus
  6. Performance Incentives
  7. Health benefits

 

 

About us:

 

The MULTIVAC Group is one of the world's leading manufacturers of integrated packaging solutions for food products of all types, for life science and healthcare products, consumer and industrial goods. The MULTIVAC Group has approximately 7,300 employees worldwide, with nearly 4,900 of these employees based out of its headquarters in Wolfertschwenden, Germany. With more than 82 subsidiaries, we are represented on all continents. The MULTIVAC product portfolio comprises a wide range of packaging technologies, labelling and marking equipment, quality control systems and automation solutions. Our product range is completed with equipment upstream of the packaging machine in the areas of portioning and processing of food – especially meat and bakery products. Further information can be found at: www.multivac.com

title: Corporate Process Analyst
job_desc:
JOB SUMMARY

The Corporate Process Analyst provides support to the Company through implementing various process improvement initiatives and projects in order to ensure strategic alignment of the organization to its goals and objectives. He/she conducts studies and reviews processes of the whole organization to improve efficiency and optimize resources. 

KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Conducts process mapping and documentation for assigned business process.
  • Analyzes processes using IE/OR methods and techniques. 
  • Develops solutions to improve the quality, quantity and efficiency of the throughput and output in coordination with process owners; utilizes process redesign, ergonomics, layout redesign, training and resource utilization.
  • Presents recommended solution, implementation plan and cost-benefit analysis to management.
  • Manages and monitors the implementation of the project in terms of output quality, cost and schedule.
  • Promote awareness on corporate policies and procedures.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

  • Graduate of a Bachelor’s/College degree in Industrial Engineering.
  • With 2 years work experience in the same field.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Knowledgeable in IE/OR methods and techniques and process improvement methodologies.
  • Good presentation skills.
  • Knowledgeable in cost-benefit analysis.
  • Knowledgeable in Process Documentation software and Industrial Engineering software. (Camunda, Minitab)

title: Sales Engineer
job_desc:
About the role

Philmetal Products, Inc., a leading manufacturer of high-quality metal products, is seeking a talented Sales Engineer to join our dynamic team in San Fernando, Pampanga. As a Sales Engineer, you will play a crucial role in driving the company's growth by providing exceptional sales and technical support to our valued customers. This is a full-time position that offers excellent opportunities for professional development and advancement within the organisation.

What you'll be doing

  • Proactively identify and pursue new sales opportunities, leveraging your technical expertise to understand customer needs and provide tailored solutions

  • Conduct technical presentations and product demonstrations to showcase the features and benefits of Philmetal's products

  • Collaborate closely with the production and engineering teams to ensure timely delivery of products and efficient resolution of customer inquiries

  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing customers, providing exceptional post-sales support and exploring opportunities for upselling and cross-selling

  • Contribute to the development of sales strategies and participate in the implementation of marketing initiatives

  • Provide detailed reports on sales activities, customer feedback, and market trends to support the company's decision-making process

What we're looking for

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in a sales or technical sales role, preferably in the steel manufacturing industry

  • Strong technical background with a solid understanding of metal products and their applications

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with customers and internal stakeholders

  • Proven track record of achieving sales targets and developing lasting customer relationships

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and the ability to learn new software applications quickly

  • A self-motivated, adaptable, and results-oriented mindset

What we offer

At Philmetal Products, Inc., we are committed to providing our employees with a supportive and rewarding work environment. Some of the key benefits you can expect as a Sales Engineer include:

  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses

  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement

title: Industrial Engineering Analyst
job_desc:
Job Description:

  • Contribute to the organization's continuous progress by applying various IE tools and techniques to real business cases.
  • Identify root cause of existing problems and develop and implement cost effective and sustainable solutions that are backed up with data analysis.
  • Create efficient flows by designing innovative tools, workstations and layout that adheres to the principles of ergonomics and executing these ideas using AutoCAD and SketchUp.
  • Eliminate non-value adding activities by performing time study, work measurement and utilizing lean concepts.
  • Ensure that approved recommendations are correctly executed by continuous monitoring during implementation and conducting on-site audit and measure.
  • Learn and practice end-to-end project management, from planning work breakdown structures to monitoring project progress until project close out.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering
  • Fresh graduates are welcome to apply
  • If experienced, background in restaurant support systems is a plus
  • Data-driven mindset with strong organizational skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (especially Excel)
  • Knowledgeable in CAD and SketchUp

title: Equipment Sales Engineer
job_desc:
Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Prospect, develop and close new business with new and existing customers.
  • Meet or exceed annual sales targets within assigned territory and accounts.
  • Regularly travel to perform customer consultations to determine needs and solutions, and obtain detailed information for estimates and proposals
  • Maintain involvement on turnkey projects, demonstrations and other related customer projects to meet deadlines and budgets
  • Possess and maintain an in-depth knowledge of distributed product lines and services presented by the company
  • Utilizing company CRM for all prospecting and customer activities
  • Collect and document competitive intelligence in your assigned territory.

Skills and Qualifications:

  • BS/BA degree in Engineering or Business or equivalent work experience
  • Previous outbound sales experience in selling manufacturing equipment is preferred
  • Knowledge and experience in data acquisition, test and measurement system is not required but will be an advantage
  • Strong professional communication and presentation skills
  • Innovative approach to problem-solving and the ability to thrive in a results-based environment.
  • Effective closer
  • Technical aptitude preferred and must be willing to learn and is determined
  • Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office as well as experience in using CRM software.
  • Must have a valid driver's license, reliable automobile transportation and current auto insurance

 

Supplementary pay types:

  • 13th month salary
  • Performance bonus

Benefits:

  • Mobile phone allowance
  • Transportation allowance

Job Type: Full Time

Experience: 2 years (B2B sales)

title: Mechanical Sales Engineer | Makati City
company: Advanced Outsourcing and Business Services Inc.
job_desc:
Responsibilities:

  • Conduct sales activities, including order reception and processing, to drive business growth.
  • Provide technical support and services to customers and users of the company products, particularly bearings.
  • Identify trends, threats, competition, etc. that may positively or negatively influence market performance and report to the management
  • Require of handling daily emails and reporting during business travel or support outside office hours whenever is needed
  • Travelling within domestically is required to meet and support sales activities, international travel (10%) may be required only when needed.
  • Supervise and participate in exhibition or roadshow when required
  • Overtime pay will be reimbursed if required during weekend or public holiday in case of customer emergency requirement.
  • Other tasks as assigned

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or related courses
  • At least 3-5 years related experience in a sales role in an engineering.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, goal-oriented, self-driven and can work under pressure.
  • Exceptional customer engagement skills, good people instincts and keen ability to form strong relationships quickly.
  • Aptitude to communicate at all levels of an organization.
  • Creative, innovative, analytical and possessing drive for excellence.
  • Proficient negotiation and presentation skills.
  • Problem solver, good at conflict management.
  • Excellent business ethics and integrity.
  • 'Can do' attitude and Sense of urgency
  • Must be able to convey effectively in both written and verbal communication in English.
  • Experience in sales engineering, especially in the bearings or related industrial and automotive industry, will be added advantage.
  • Successful candidate maybe be required to undergo technical training abroad to Japan and Thailand when assigned.

SALARY & BENEFITS:

  • Transportation allowance
  • HMO
  • Commission

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Php40,000.00 - Php50,000.00 per month

Benefits:

 

  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Opportunities for promotion
  • Paid training

title: Business Process and Continuous Improvement Specialist
job_desc:
Job Responsibilities:

  • Develop initiatives for continuous business process improvements.
  • Develop best practices for business process improvements.
  • Design, develop and implement business processes to achieve organization goals.
  • Track and communicate status of business initiative projects to management.
  • Plan, implement and monitor business process changes for projects.
  • Assist in making business decisions relating to system implementation, modification, maintenance, etc.
  • Develop and maintain business process documentations that will be used as reference for preparing test cases, training documents, etc.
  • Update business processes to meet changing business needs.
  • Present analyses, solutions and business cases to senior management.
  • Coordinate with a cross-functional team to develop business process requirements.
  • Implement continuous analysis to support process transformation with changing business environment.
  • Participates in process improvement initiatives & contributes best practices or analysis from a process person perspective
  • Performs in quality assurance tasks e.g. quality gates check, audits, process inventory, etc.
  • Assist in defining quality control scenarios or use case; helps ensure that process are complete in any tool introduction.
  • Contributes to the incident or crisis management & gap analysis discussion/s.

 

Job Qualifications:

  • Have at least 3 years of industry experience in governance, process frameworks, leading process improvements/standards/etc for an IT service delivery industry.
  • Bachelor's Degree Graduate - preferably in Industrial Engineering, Business, Accountancy or any related courses
  • Has basic knowledge in process documentations such as work instructions, process maps, and policies.
  • Knowledgeable in process analysis, streamlining, and documentation; Proficient in using various BPM tools and models
  • Lean Six Sigma (Yellow Belt), Foundational Business Process Mgmt. or any other related trainings
  • Can start ASAP
  • Willing to be assigned in Makati City

title: Warranty Account Program Management Specialist
job_desc:
POSITION SUMMARY:

The Warranty Program Manager will be responsible for developing and optimizing process workflows specific to designated Business Units. This role focuses on enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of warranty operations, ensuring alignment with business objectives, and improving the customer experience through targeted process enhancements. The position emphasizes the use of Smartsheet or similar applications to create workflow automations, reporting, and dynamic views tailored to user roles. In addition, the Warranty Program Manager will manage issue escalations in a high-volume, customer-focused environment.

 

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Customer Focus: Review and analyze processes within assigned Business Units, aiming to improve the customer experience through efficiency gains and process improvements.

  • Issue Escalations: Handle and manage escalated warranty-related issues, ensuring timely resolution by coordinating with relevant teams.

  • Process Workflow Development: Develop, implement, and optimize workflows specific to warranty administration, using Smartsheet or similar applications to build workflow automations, reporting tools, and individualized dynamic views based on user roles.

  • Process Optimization: Evaluate existing warranty processes, identify inefficiencies, and recommend data-driven improvements to enhance operational efficiency.

  • Workflow Automation: Create and manage automated workflows to streamline warranty processes, ensuring tasks are completed efficiently and accurately.

  • Reporting & Metrics: Develop and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) and dashboards to monitor the effectiveness of warranty processes, and report findings and recommendations to senior management.

  • Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with Product Development, Sales, Technical Support, and other internal teams to ensure warranty processes support the needs of the specific Business Units.

  • Address operational challenges promptly to minimize disruptions and maintain efficiency.

  • Ensure that customer needs and expectations are met by prioritizing quality service and quick response times.

  • Identify inefficiencies and implement changes to enhance workflow and productivity.

  • Optimize the use of personnel, equipment, and materials to maintain cost-effectiveness.

  • Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and take corrective actions when needed.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Engineering, Operations, or a related field is desired.

  • 4-8 years of experience in process development, program management, or project management, ideally within a warranty or customer service environment.

  • Strong experience in process analysis and workflow optimization.

  • Ability to lead cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to drive results.

  • Advanced knowledge of Smartsheet for creating automated workflows, dynamic views, and reporting tools.

  • Advanced knowledge of Power BI or other analytics and reporting platforms, with the ability to create dashboards and generate insights from data.

  • Excellent analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data, generate insights, and develop actionable strategies.

  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present data and recommendations to various stakeholders.

  • Proficiency in relevant software and tools, such as Microsoft Office Suite and CRM systems.

  • Experience in a high-volume, customer-focused environment.

  • Knowledge of industry standards and best practices in warranty management.

  • Certification in Data Analytics, Project Management (PMP), or Six Sigma is a plus.

The successful candidate will embrace Vertiv’s Core Principals & Behaviors to help execute our Strategic Priorities. 

OUR CORE PRINCIPALS:  Safety.  Integrity.  Respect.  Teamwork.  Diversity & Inclusion.

OUR STRATEGIC PRIORITIES

·       Customer Focus

·       Operational Excellence

·       High-Performance Culture

·       Innovation

·       Financial Strength

OUR BEHAVIORS

·       Own It

·       Act With Urgency

·       Foster a Customer-First Mindset

·       Think Big and Execute

·       Lead by Example

·       Drive Continuous Improvement

Learn and Seek Out Development

title: Business Analyst (Logistics)
job_desc:
As Business Analyst, you will partner with the business, interface with multiple stakeholders, gather requirements, and provide a clear road map for all development projects while being responsible as site owner for all functional areas regarding the business systems

Key Responsibilities:

  • Business Process Analysis – Work closely with Product Manager and Stakeholders to analyze petroleum logistics workflows, identifying ERP requirements and areas for system optimization.

  • ERP Strategy & Utilization – Provide guidance on leveraging current ERP capabilities to improve efficiency 

  • Requirements Gathering & Documentation – Define and document business needs for ERP enhancements, ensuring alignment with operational goals and regulatory standards.

  • Project & Change Management – Assess new project requests, initiatives, and system changes, ensuring they align with business priorities and ERP best practices.

  • Collaboration with Development Team – Partner with technical teams to coordinate ERP system enhancements, integrations, and troubleshooting.

  • Testing & Quality Assurance – Assist in testing ERP updates, patches, and new features to ensure reliability and functionality before deployment.

  • Training & Support – Provide end-user training, documentation, and ongoing support to ensure effective system usage.

  • Compliance & Continuous Improvement – Stay updated on ERP advancements and industry regulations to drive system improvements and maintain compliance

Qualifications

  • Able to work in our offices 4 days per week/hybrid

  • 2 to 3 years in Software Logistics, Supply Chain experience

  • Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science, or 5+ years of equivalent experience.

  • A minimum of 3 years of experience in an ERP Software Products or applications  

  • Ability to effectively work with end users and business teams for requirements gathering, understanding customer needs, testing, etc.

  • Strong understanding of Logistics Systems

Preferred Qualifications

  • Great organizational and time management skills.

  • Exceptional interpersonal, collaboration, and communication abilities.

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Ability to be proactive and take initiative.

  • Works independently with minimal guidance required.

  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.

  • Strong problem-solving skills.

  • A background in business administration and/or project management.

title: Business Process Analyst
job_desc:
About Us

 

As a market leader in Business Process Optimization and IT services for over 20 years, Canon Business Services Centre Philippines helps organizations optimize, automate, and transform their operations, setting them up for greater growth. We work collaboratively with customers to get the results they want, delivering bespoke solutions designed to meet and exceed their business needs, overcoming challenges, and freeing them up to focus on what sets them apart.

We’re trusted by industry leaders because of our dedicated customer focus, and agile approaches to solving our clients’ key challenges. With a commitment to delivering the best service management experience possible, many clients have partnered with us for more than a decade. The solutions we deliver are reliable, scalable, and cost-effective, helping customers to not just get ahead but stay ahead.

When you join Canon Business Services Centre, you’ll find a rewarding culture that values you. You’ll be empowered to focus on your career progression and turn your goals into reality as an integral part of the group’s success.

 

About the Role

 

The role of the Business Process Analyst to assist the business in implementing organizational development solutions in a cost-effective way by determining the requirements of a project or program, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and partners.

The role will be assigned the following responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the analysis and evaluation of the company’s business performance, providing critical business information to senior management in making strategic plans to improve overall performance
  • Identify opportunities for improving business processes
  • Propose best practice solutions and tools to improve/optimize workflow, identify areas for synergy and integration and simplify complex processes
  • Process modelling and analysis skills including but not limited to process improvements, gap analysis between current and future state along with root cause analysis
  • Perform cost analysis of the company to improve cost-effectivity
  • Create new entity strategies for organizational development

 

Qualifications

 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Industrial engineering, Business, Finance, or related course
  • Six Sigma Certification is an asset but not a requirement
  • At least 2 years related work experience with demonstrated Transition and Project management skills specific to offshore transition in BPO companies

 

If this sounds like you, we’d love you to apply!

 

We believe in the power of an inclusive and diverse workforce. We trust you will bring your authentic self to work, and we will focus on making sure that together, we make a strong contribution to the broader community in which we operate. Where possible, flexible working arrangements are the norm, as we know a better work-life balance can improve your motivation, performance, and productivity.

 

As an equal opportunity employer, all applicants will be considered. Benefits/perks may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Canon Group and the country where you work. All applicants must be eligible to work in the country they are applying to at the time of application.

 

Looking to join this diverse team? Apply online now.


Successful applicants will be notified of next steps

title: Sales and Service Representative
job_desc:
About the role

As a Sales and Service Engineer at Prince Valiant International Corporation, you will play a crucial role in driving the company's growth and success. This full-time position is based in the Bicol Region and or Other Luzon Regions and involves engaging with customers, providing technical expertise, and delivering exceptional sales and after-sales support. Your strategic contributions will be instrumental in expanding the company's market presence and strengthening its position as a leader in the industry.

What you'll be doing

  • Actively identify and pursue new sales opportunities, leveraging your strong technical knowledge and industry expertise

  • Deliver consultative sales presentations, providing tailored solutions that address customers' specific needs

  • Maintain and nurture strong relationships with existing customers, ensuring their satisfaction and loyalty

  • Provide on-site technical support and after-sales services, ensuring the smooth operation of our products and solutions

  • Collaborate with the engineering and product teams to provide valuable feedback and insights for product development and improvement

  • Participate in industry events, trade shows, and networking activities to stay informed about market trends and build a strong professional network

What we're looking for

  • Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in a sales or technical sales role, preferably within the Sales industry

  • Strong technical background and understanding of the Sales and Service Engineer - for Scientific & Enginering domain

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage with customers at all levels

  • Demonstrated success in achieving sales targets and delivering exceptional customer satisfaction

  • Proactive and adaptable, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team

  • Proficient in the use of sales and customer relationship management (CRM) tools

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Science, Business, or a related field

What we offer

  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses

  • Comprehensive benefits package (including insurance and commissions)

  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement

  • Opportunity for training abroad

  • Supportive and collaborative work environment

  • Work-life balance initiatives, such as flexible work arrangements

About us

Prince Valiant International Corporation is a leading provider of innovative solutions in the field of Forensic, Scientific and Engineering Industry. With a strong presence in the country, we are dedicated to delivering high-quality products and exceptional customer service. Our commitment to innovation, sustainability, and customer satisfaction has made us a trusted partner for businesses across the region. Join our dynamic team and be a part of our continued success story.

Apply now for this exciting opportunity!

title: Sales Design Specialist
job_desc:
Job Description:

  • Responsible in effective and efficient planning and organizing of sales activities to promote the brands and ensure the products get specified by developing relationship and working with target clients.
  • The position shall also perform by attaining or exceeding the set goals and expand market share through quality service while maintaining a healthy pricing and profit margin.

Qualifications:

  • A graduate in Industrial Engineering and Business-Related Courses
  • Relevant experience in the same field is an advantage
  • Strong confidence, creative, organized, and resilient
  • Has good written and verbal communication skill
  • A team player and must have a strong interest in self-development.
  • At least 2 years of experience as a Sales Design Specialist, or in a similar role. 

Benefits

  • Sales commission on top of basic salary*
  • Healthcare
  • Government Benefits
  • 13th Month Pay

title: Business Analyst (Inventory)
job_desc:
iRely is looking for a Business Analyst to join their Product Development Team to work on the Inventory Accounting Module of their Software Product. This role is integral to the ongoing success and retention of our customers, and the competitiveness of our software products. 

 

Skills & Qualifications 

  • 6 plus years of experience and a minimum of 4 years experience as Software Business Analyst for Inventory Accounting/Manufacturing domain.
  • Analyzing the customer issues, doing impact analysis on existing product features and suggest changes.
  • Documenting business requirements, preparing statement of work and design solutions for the product
  • Good Communication Skills
  • Experience working with ERP on Inventory Accounting.
  • Experience in Perpetual Inventory Accounting systems.
  • Experience in various costing methods like FIFO, LIFO, Average, Actual Cost and Lot cost.
  • Experience in Inventory Adjustment, Cost Adjustments and Inventory Count.
  • Experience in month end processing, balancing inventory valuation with financial reports and month closing.
  • Knowledge in Logistics, Financial Accounting, Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable.
  • Experience leading a team.
  • Good to have experience in fuel or commodity trading.
  • Experience in MS SQL and Jira is nice to have.
  • High Ownership Attitude
  • Leadership skills

Duties & Responsibilities 

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and document their requirements.
  • Designing Features and taking ownership of the delivery of changes.
  • Resolving any issues and clarifications from existing customers. 
  • Supporting Implementation & Sales.
  • Assist the Product Manager in sprint planning and daily scrum.
  • Laison with a team of developers and QAs to deliver sprints.

title: Business Process Analyst (Supplier Management) - Night Shift
job_desc:
Business Process Analyst will develop and implement multi-year strategies for assigned commodities, suppliers and systems and administration to achieve established goals in supplier quality, delivery, price and service. They align strategy and execution with cross-functional partners such as engineering, manufacturing, product management and functional owners. They execute the competitive bid, negotiation, contracting processes and/or technical continuous improvement for assigned commodities or services; collaborate across Business Units and cross-regions for optimal TE leverage. Our teams demonstrate a high level of expertise in procurement competencies (business/supply chain acumen, negotiation, sourcing strategy development and execution, global savvy, and project and product lifecycle management) and ensure results are delivered compliant with TE policies and procedures.

This position would be based in the Philippines

  • Procurement applications and process onboarding
  • Initiate communications with suppliers and stakeholders
  • Provide Help desk Ticket Support for suppliers
  • Data tracking and analytics for product environmental compliance regulations
  • Data tracking and analytics for social regulations (conflict minerals)
  • Data tracking and analytics for sustainability
  • Training and managing system challenges for B2B and Supplier base
  • Submit inquiries to global vendors on compliance issues
  • Providing Sourcing support to the  core team

WHAT WE NEED:

  • Bachelor's degree graduate of any engineering course
  • Working knowledge in Excel, Power BI, Tableau
  • With a background in ticketing systems such as Service Now or any similar tools
  • With experience in Procurement applications and process onboarding
  • Problem-solving skills
  • Starter and motivator

title: Technical Sales Analyst
job_desc:
Position Summary:

To provide technical support through customizing submittal documents, and searching, tracking and processing Thermal Management sales opportunities that will allow the Vertiv Sales Representatives to close business quickly and supply their customers with the most accurate equipment selections and solutions for their applications, based on plans, specifications and design condition. Provide support for Local Vertiv Offices (LVO’s) through tracking, documenting, reviewing and coordinating bid opportunities with the sales representatives and external customers (all bidders/contractors).
 

Job Responsibilities:

  • Provide customized submittal packages on Thermal Management products requested by the sales representatives and/or customers
  • Perform bid reviews on different FTP, builders exchange or contractor sites to search for Thermal Management product leads and opportunities
  • Perform daily customer engagement through calls and emails on tracking the status of the bids-to-quotes-to-orders transactions while identifying the results (won/lost/abandoned/cancelled) and reasons.
  • Perform tracking, documenting and coordinating bid opportunities with the sales representatives and external
    customers (all bidders/contractors)
  • Identifies customer needs through communication and probing.
  • Creates solutions to customer problems.  Provide sound recommendations to their queries. Provides resolution the first time.
  • Assists customers in handling, servicing, follow-up, communication and closure of issues.
  • Completes workload on time. Monitors if transactions are processed in a timely manner.
  • Implements error-proofing method to ensure all transactions done are accurately.
  • Participates in conferences calls, meetings and discussions with customers.

Job Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or any HVAC-R equivalent
  • Refrigeration, electrical, and HVAC background or related technical degree.
  • 1-2 years of HVAC-R experience
  • 1-2 years of customer service and sales technical support experience
  • At least 18 months as Associate Engineer (Technical Support) with the team
  • Thorough knowledge of refrigeration and air-conditioning basics
  • Knowledgeable in interpreting Mechanical drawings and specifications
  • Knowledge on Adobe Acrobat Professional and Microsoft Excel and other MS Office applications
  • Can communicate clearly using the English language in both written and oral form
  • Knowledge on data center operation
  • Good analytical and mathematical skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills
  • Can work independently with minimal supervision
  • Excellent time management and problem-solving skills
  • Demonstrated industry, systems and process knowledge
  • Culturally attuned to customers around the globe

The successful candidate will embrace Vertiv’s Core Principals & Behaviors to help execute our Strategic Priorities. 
 

OUR CORE PRINCIPALS:  Safety.  Integrity. Respect.  Teamwork.  Diversity & Inclusion.

OUR STRATEGIC PRIORITIES

  • Customer Focus
  • Operational Excellence
  • High-Performance Culture
  • Innovation
  • Financial Strength

OUR BEHAVIORS

  • Own It
  • Act With Urgency
  • Foster a Customer-First Mindset
  • Think Big and Execute
  • Lead by Example
  • Drive Continuous Improvement
  • Learn and Seek Out Development

title: Sales Executive
company: Misumi South East Asia Pte Ltd

title: Research and Development Specialist
job_desc:

Developing Product Designs

title: Business Development Supervisor
job_desc:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

Market Research and Analysis

  • Conduct extensive primary and secondary research to identify market trends, customer needs, and competitive positioning.
  • Analyze industry data to uncover gaps and opportunities for new product development or business expansion.

Business Plan

  • Prepare business plan for proposed projects, considering market demand, financial viability, and operational requirements.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations to management on go/no-go decisions for new initiatives.

New Product /Service Development

  • Lead the conceptualization and development of new products/services, ensuring alignment with company objectives and market demands.
  • Collaborate with other departments to design, test, and launch new offerings.

Project Management

  • Oversee the implementation of approved projects, ensuring timely and cost-effective delivery.
  • Monitor project milestones and report progress to management.

Reporting and Presentations

  • Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations for management, summarizing research findings, project status, and strategic recommendations.

 

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Economics, or Business Administration, Management, Industrial Engineer or other related fields.
  • At least 4-5 years of experience in business development, market research, or new product development.
  • Preferably has proven track record of leading successful business initiatives and product launches.
  • Strong ability to analyze market data and translate insights into strategies.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to build and nurture relationships with diverse stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).

title: Product Life Cycle Manager (Industrial & BOM expertise)
job_desc:
Be a part of our fast-growing team and unchain all the possibilities!
 

What is your mission?

We are looking for a Product Lifecycle Management Manager to lead a high-performance team of creative and industrial designers, product data analysts, and product management associates. This role focuses on driving operational excellence, team development, and effective communication across product and engineering functions. You will oversee product creation, leveraging data insights to optimize performance and streamline processes, while collaborating with teams like sales and supply chain. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in managing international clients in engineering and industrial design.

You will provide the best service to our partner brands by performing these tasks:

Product Data Management

  • System Administration: Act as the escalation point for Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) system issues handled by the team. Leverage the PLM system to efficiently manage and store data, using data analytics tools to generate actionable insights. Automate repetitive tasks to improve accuracy and efficiency.
  • Process Management: Ensure data quality by establishing robust procedures to maintain accuracy, consistency, and reliability. Streamline workflows to reduce bottlenecks, and maintain comprehensive documentation of processes to ensure consistency and compliance.
  • Reporting & Analytics: Monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure the team's effectiveness and productivity. Generate regular reports on data quality, system performance, and team productivity, and continuously review and improve processes, tools, and metrics.

Creative Design

  • Artwork Renders: Ensure timely submission of render requests and ensure they are delivered as scheduled.
  • Packaging Artworks: Oversee the creation and preflight check of packaging designs, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery.
  • Color Material Finish (CMF) Requests: Manage the execution and timely delivery of CMF requests, including both base artworks and preflight materials.
  • Adhoc Requests: Address and complete various creative requests within the given project timelines, maintaining artistic quality.

Management and Leadership

  • Data-Driven Decisions: Use data analysis and performance metrics to identify trends and areas for improvement, offering solutions based on data insights.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams such as customer service, product, and operations to design and implement improvements.
  • Project Coordination: Assist in managing project timelines, resources, and deliverables related to process optimization, tool development, and service improvements.
  • Project Documentation: Maintain and update project plans, schedules, and documentation to ensure transparency and accountability across the team.
  • Risk & Issue Management: Identify potential risks or issues within projects and collaborate with relevant teams to develop mitigation strategies.
  • Project Reporting: Track progress against KPIs, budgets, and timelines, providing regular updates to stakeholders on project status.

 

Who are we looking for?

  • At least 5 years of managerial experience in the industrial or engineering industry.
  • Strong knowledge of the product life cycle and proficiency in Bill of Materials (BOM) management.
  • Experience with consumer packaged goods (CPG) or physical products (not services).
  • Skilled in reporting, data management, and maintaining high data accuracy.
  • Expertise in tool and project management, with experience handling raw materials.
  • Creative design experience, including color comparison.
  • Solid risk management and communication skills.
  • Experience managing international clients is a plus.

 

Company Perks

  • Above-industry salary package and incentives
  • Comprehensive HMO benefits and life insurance from day 1
  • Free learning and development courses for your personal and career growth
  • Dynamic company events
  • Opportunities for promotion
  • Free meals and snacks

title: Enterprise Business Analyst
job_desc:
Join Our Dynamic ICT Team as an Enterprise Business Analyst!

We are looking for a skilled Enterprise Business Analyst to be a key player in our ICT Team. This role offers the opportunity to make a significant impact on our business systems and overall business success.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Manages projects.

  • Documents business processes and procedures.

  • Aligns customer business requirements with system specifications and prepares relevant documentation.

  • Provides comprehensive support, including ERP transactional assistance, configuration, training, and handling access authorization requests.

  • Introduces new technologies, tools, and processes to enhance internal or customer operations and reduce costs.

  • Conducts training sessions for users and IT personnel.

  • Implements process improvements to optimize efficiency.

Qualifications:

  • Degree in Engineering

  • Minimum of 1 year of experience in an EMS company

  • With at least one year of related work experience in a manufacturing company, particularly in the field of finance, supply chain or IT

  • Knowledge of manufacturing SAP Production Planning (SAP PP)

  • Knowledge of manufacturing, supply chain, finance business processes

  • Knowledge of ERP systems functions; experience in a manufacturing set-up is an advantage

  • Ability to create business process flows

  • Knowledge of ERP transactions and configuration

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills

If you're ready to leverage your analytical skills and expertise to help us achieve our goals, apply today and join us on this exciting journey!

title: Sales Engineer
job_desc:
We are hiring Sales Engineers

As we continue to expand, we are looking for individuals who have the ability to generate new business opportunities while managing and growing an existing customer base. This will be an opportunity for you to manage your designated sales territory.

 

Qualifications:

  • Graduate of any Engineering Course (Preferably EE, ECE, ICE and ME).
  • With at least 2 years proven experience in industrial sales.
  • Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • In-depth knowledge of and experience with the sales process.
  • Excels at lead generation, relationship building, and closing deals.
  • Must know how to drive.

Benefits:
Above-Average salary
Statutory benefits
Training Benefits (Local and International
HMO upon regularization
Performance Incentives
Performance Bonus
Other additional benefits

title: EOI: Sr. Solutions Analyst
job_desc:
About the Role

As a CBRE Solutions Sr. Analyst will be responsible for creating long-term strategic relationships between key internal and external partners. This job is part of the Sales function. They are responsible for the design of sales solutions that are presented and sold to potential, new, and existing clients





What You'll Do

  • Facilitate the engagement of key internal and external partners when delivering services and change projects.
  • Support the development of complex management strategies, plans, and needs.
  • Provide advice and recommendations, based on enhanced experience, to address needs.
  • Monitor and improve relationships. This includes documenting lessons learned and obtaining the appropriate feedback.
  • Support actions to improve relations and open communications with and between upper-level management.
  • Deliver agreed outcomes from projects using advanced techniques, collaboration, and governance.
  • Apply general knowledge of standard principles and techniques/procedures to accomplish assigned tasks and solve routine problems
  • Have a broad knowledge of own job discipline and some knowledge of several job disciplines within the function.
  • Lead by example and model behaviors that are consistent with CBRE RISE values. May convince to reach an agreement.
  • Impact the quality of own work and the work of others on the team.
  • Work primarily within standardized procedures and practices to achieve objectives and meet deadlines.
  • Explain complex information to others in straightforward situations.

title: Sales Engineer
job_desc:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Sales Engineer to drive technical sales and business development efforts. This role requires a combination of engineering expertise and sales acumen to provide solutions that meet client needs. This role involves identifying business opportunities, building relationships with clients, and providing technical solutions to meet customer needs.

Key Responsibilities:

Business Development & Sales:

  • Identify and target potential clients in industries requiring energy-saving solutions.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers.
  • Conduct sales presentations, technical discussions, and product demonstrations.
  • Prepare and negotiate contracts, proposals, and quotations based on client needs.

Technical Consultation & Solution Selling:

  • Analyze customer energy usage and recommend cost-effective energy-saving solutions.
  • Provide technical expertise on energy-efficient products and systems.
  • Collaborate with engineering teams to customize solutions that meet client requirements.

Market Research & Strategy:

  • Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and new technologies.
  • Gather customer feedback and market intelligence to improve sales strategies.
  • Participate in trade shows, conferences, and networking events.

Project Coordination & After-Sales Support:

  • Work closely with project teams to ensure smooth implementation of energy-saving solutions.
  • Provide after-sales support, including troubleshooting and technical guidance.
  • Ensure customer satisfaction and build long-term partnerships.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Electronics, Civil, or related field).
  • Minimum 4 years of experience in sales, preferably in the electrical or energy industry.
  • Strong technical knowledge of energy-saving solutions, power systems, or renewable energy technologies is highly advantageous.
  • Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
  • Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
  • Ability to understand technical specifications and translate them into customer benefits.
  • Willingness to travel for client meetings and industry events.

title: Sr. IE Analyst
job_desc:
BRIEF DESCRIPTION

The Senior IE Analyst is responsible for mapping, analyzing, and optimizing processes across multiple departments to enhance efficiency and reduce operational risks. This role involves leading process improvement initiatives, managing projects, facilitating communication, and leveraging technical proficiency to implement innovative solutions.  


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Map and document existing processes across various departments.

  • Create detailed flowcharts and process documentation to ensure clarity and consistency.

  • Analyze processes for inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and risks.

  • Use data-driven approaches to identify root causes of operational issues.

  • Identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend effective solutions.

  • Develop and propose strategies to optimize processes and enhance performance.

  • Benchmark processes against industry best practices to ensure competitive advantage.

  • Lead the implementation of approved process improvement initiatives.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth and effective implementation.

  • Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and budgets for process improvement projects.

  • Ensure projects are completed within scope, on time, and within budget.

  • Coordinate with stakeholders and team members to ensure alignment and project success.

  • Facilitate communication and collaboration among team members and stakeholders.

  • Track project progress, manage risks, and address any issues that arise.

  • Evaluate project outcomes and success against predefined metrics.

  • Prepare and present comprehensive reports on project results and recommendations to management.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor's Degree in Industrial Engineering, Business Management, Operations Management, Engineering Management, or a related field Master's Degree in Business Administration or Engineering Management (preferred but not required)

  • 5 to 7 years of experience doing Operations Engineering, Process Improvement, and Analysis

  • Experience in working for a logistics company is an advantage

  • Must be proficient in data analysis and use of Excel

  • Willing to do field work in cold storage warehouses
